channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Confirmed COVID-19 cases in Philippines now at 178,022
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: (Updated 4:28 p.m.) Since the coronavirus emerged late last year, more than 22.26 million have been infected worldwide and over 784,000 have died.

item.title: DOJ: PhilHealth exec says current IT system cannot detect fraudulent claims
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: A senior officer of the Philippine Health Insurance (PhilHealth) Corp. revealed the current Information Technology system of the state insurer cannot detect fraudulent claims, the Department of Justice said Thursday.

item.title: Teachers' group to Congress: Make education sector a top priority for 'Bayanihan 2'
item.description: "We from the Alliance of Concerned Teachers (ACT) Philippines hereby forward that the education sector be included in the top priorities for budget allocation under the second legislative measure that aims to bolster the government’s pandemic response," the group said.

item.title: DILG: 'Disiplina' campaign about volunteerism, not enforcement
item.description: "The BIDA ang may Disiplina campaign is a joint effort of the DILG and DOH to encourage family and community participation in the battle against COVID-19 by living a life of discipline and earnestly practicing the minimum health standards set by health authorities."

item.title: Killing of Zara Alvarez highlights dangers of red-tagging — CHR
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The Commission on Human Rights said its regional office has already opened a motu proprio investigation into the killing of Alvarez.

item.title: Families of 14 missing Filipinos in Mindoro collision to receive P1 million each
item.description: MV Vienna Wood will provide compensations worth P1 million each to the families of the 14 Filipinos who went missing following the maritime mishap.

item.title: 'Jeepneys are safe': Transport groups stage protest outside LTFRB office
item.description: (Updated 4:24 p.m.) "What we're asking for is for 100% of [traditional jeepneys] to be able to ride again and serve the public and help lift the economy of our country. We want drivers and operators to have a livelihood again and for the public to have rides going to work again, and we want the drivers to be given their aid," he said.

item.title: Deadline for application docs for Judiciary, Legal Education Board posts moved to September
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: The Judicial and Bar Council extended the deadline for submission of application requirements for several openings at the Judiciary and the Legal Education Board.

item.title: Gordon urges quick filing of cases vs PhilHealth execs accused of corruption
item.description: "Sigaw lang tayo nang sigaw sa Kongreso pero walang nangyayari. People don't go to jail," Gordon said during an interview.

item.title: In need of lifeline, millions of tourism industry workers rely on Bayanihan 2’s pledge for pandemic financial aid
item.author: Rosette Adel
item.description: An estimated 4.8 million formal and informal tourism industry workers have been affected by the various levels of community quarantines in the Philippines.
